description:
Scenario : when stack.sh(from devstack) script is run for the first time and if for any reason the user unstack the openstack by using unstack.sh and clean.sh. And then again install it

Issue : during 2nd run of stack.sh , few nova services specially n-cpu and n-api fails running. It happens because of unstacking the last stack these services was not killed.

During 2nd run, the log file says : multiple services running on the same address (same URI).
there would be multiple duplicate services runs which causes current install fails.

the above message can be view. on running the services
for example. just run nova-api on terminal

Traceback : it will show address already in use. ERROR
title: multiple services running causes failure

comments.content:
Scenario : when stack.sh(from devstack) script is run for the first time and if for any reason the user unstack the openstack by using unstack.sh and clean.sh. And then again install it

Issue : during 2nd run of stack.sh , few nova services specially n-cpu and n-api fails running. It happens because of unstacking the last stack these services was not killed.

During 2nd run, the log file says : multiple services running on the same address (same URI).
there would be multiple duplicate services runs which causes current install fails.

the above message can be view. on running the services
for example. just run nova-api on terminal

Traceback : it will show address already in use. ERROR
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~neerkaveri

comments.content: What causes n-cpu and n-api to not die during the previous unstack?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jogo

comments.content:
This is not a Nova bug, stacking and unstacking is done using scripts from devstack. Anyways, you can solve this problem by killing the n-api and n-cpu process. You can do something like this:
ps aux | grep "nova", then kill the nova-api and nova-compute processes. I believe this problem happens when you have multiple workers for nova-api.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~maithem

comments.content:
hello maithem

when i got this issue the first thing i did was that only, killing all n-api or n-cpu processes(as there were multiple processes running). then again i executed ./stack.sh. but the outcome was same.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~neerkaveri

comments.content: This isn't a nova issue, please raise on the ML or raise a devstack bug.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~johngarbutt
